title: FPS drops and weird pixely VFX since 7.16

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
Ever since the patch, champions with certain particles (and keystones like grasp, fervor, and warlords) have a strange pixely effect that drastically reduces my fps. Literally just panning my camera over an illaoi gives me sub 20 fps.
Help!

replies.body:
I am having this same issue on my 2009 iMac. Specs are:
2009 iMac
OSX Sierra 10.12.6
2.8 GHz intel i7
16 GB 1067 MHz DDR3 ram
ATI Radeon HD 4850 512 MB vram

I have done the following Troubleshooting steps:

System is Completely Up to Date
Tried in every spec mode (I have always played at full settings, I have tried every notch on the provided video spec bar)
I have reset the SMC
I have reset the NVRAM
I have 'repaired' the install
I have deleted (trash-emptied) my installation of LoL
I have re-installed LoL

No Improvement has been noted.

This issue is triggered by Miss Fortune's "Make It Rain" and is very specific to that action. There may be more but it's my partner's account and he's kind of a smurf so he doesn't have or play a variety of champions.

MF is one of his favourites so like, please take this seriously...

To put this into perspective I am running a 2012 Samsung ATIV 700T which has an integrated gfx processor. My own computer is completely under-spec'd compared to the iMac however I do not experience ANY issue with any champion. My Samsung is running a fully updated version of windows 10.
I'm having the same exact problem with that on mac also. Bard tunnel and darkstar thresh makes my fps drop for some reason too. and hey all have the same pixely effects.

Windows 10’s Game DVR feature can slow your gaming performance by recording video in the background. If you don’t care about recording your gameplay, disable Game DVR for performance reasons.

Unfortunately, Game DVR takes system resources. On a slower computer–or if you just want maximum graphical horsepower for your games–it can noticeably slow your in-game performance and lower your FPS. If you don’t care about recording your gameplay, you’ll want to disable this feature. This Game DVR feature may or may not be enabled by default, depending on your PC’s hardware.

Please disable both Game DVR and Game Bar.

To disable Game DVR, head to Settings > Gaming > Game DVR. Ensure the “Record in the background while I’m playing a game” option here is set to “Off”.

To disable the Game Bar, head to Settings > Gaming > Game Bar. Set the “Record game clips, screenshots, and broadcast using Game bar” option here to “Off”.
